sen.j: 京極 高備（きょうごく たかまさ、宝暦7年4月22日 (旧暦)（1757年6月8日）- 天保6年5月3日 (旧暦)（1835年5月29日））は、丹後国峰山藩の第7代藩主。
sen.e: Takamasa KYOGOKU (June 8, 1757-May 29, 1835) was the seventh lord of the Mineyama Domain of the Tango Province.
Takamasa KYOGOKU (June 8, 1757-May 29, 1835) was the seventh lord of Mineyama Domain in Tango Province.
sen.cmt: the Mineyama Domain of the Tango Province をMineyama Domain in Tango Province に修正しました。
sen.e: Takamasa KYOGOKU (June 8, 1757-May 29, 1835) was the seventh lord of Mineyama Domain in Tango Province.

sen.j: 第6代藩主・京極高久の長男。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of the sixth lord of the domain, Takahisa KYOGOKU.
He was the oldest son of the sixth lord of the domain, Takahisa KYOGOKU.
sen.cmt: eldest を oldest に修正しました。
sen.e: He was the oldest son of the sixth lord of the domain, Takahisa KYOGOKU.
His mother was a daughter of Toshikiyo KINOSHITA.
His mother was a daughter of Toshikiyo KINOSHITA.
His mother was a daughter of Toshikiyo KINOSHITA.

sen.j: 正室は土方雄端の娘、継室は本多康桓の娘。
sen.e: His lawful wife was a daughter of Katsumasa HIJIKATA and his second wife was a daughter of Yasutake HONDA.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Katsumasa HIJIKATA and his second wife was a daughter of Yasutake HONDA.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Katsumasa HIJIKATA and his second wife was a daughter of Yasutake HONDA.

sen.j: 子に京極高寧（長男）、京極高聡（次男）、京極高倍（五男）、京極高鎮（七男）、娘（黒田直方継室のち山口弘致正室）。
sen.e: His children included Takayasu KYOGOKU (eldest son), Takatoshi KYOGOKU (second son), Takamasu KYOGOKU (fifth son), Takatsune KYOGOKU (seventh son), and a daughter (who became Naokata KURODA's second wife and later, Hiromune YAMAGUCHI's lawful wife).

His children included Takayasu KYOGOKU (first son), Takatoshi KYOGOKU (second son), Takamasu KYOGOKU (fifth son), Takatsune KYOGOKU (seventh son), and a daughter (who became Naokata KURODA's second wife and later, Hiromune YAMAGUCHI's lawful wife).
sen.cmt: eldest を first に修正しました。
sen.e: His children included Takayasu KYOGOKU (first son), Takatoshi KYOGOKU (second son), Takamasu KYOGOKU (fifth son), Takatsune KYOGOKU (seventh son), and a daughter (who became Naokata KURODA's second wife and later, Hiromune YAMAGUCHI's lawful wife).

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、周防国守。
sen.e: His official court rank and title was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Suo no kuni no Kami (Governor of Suo Province).
His official court rank and title was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Suo no kuni no Kami (Governor of Suo Province).
His official court rank and title was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Suo no kuni no Kami (Governor of Suo Province).

sen.j: 宝暦7年（1757年）4月22日、江戸にて生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Edo on April 22, 1757.
He was born in Edo on June 8, 1757.
sen.cmt: April 22 を June 8 に修正しました。
sen.e: He was born in Edo on June 8, 1757.
His childhood name was Sennosuke.
His childhood name was Sennosuke.
His childhood name was Sennosuke.

sen.j: 天明8年（1788年）、父が若年寄になると藩政を取り仕切る立場になった。
sen.e: When his father became a wakadoshiyori to serve the shogunate government in 1788, Takamasa took the position to preside the administration of the domain.
sen.cmt: 主節への文脈を明確にするため「若年寄」が幕政に携わることに関する説明的な句を追加しました。
sen.e: When his father became a wakadoshiyori (a managerial position in Edo bakufu) to serve the shogunate government in 1788, Takamasa took the position to preside the administration of the domain.
sen.cmt: wakadoshiyori に (junior councilor) を追記しました。
sen.e: When his father became a wakadoshiyori (a managerial position in Edo bakufu) to serve the shogunate government in 1788, Takamasa took the position to preside the administration of the domain.

sen.j: 文化 (元号)5年（1808年）、父の死去により家督を継いだ。
sen.e: In 1808 when his father died, he succeeded to his father to take over the position of the family head.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1808 when his father died, he succeeded to his father to take over the position of the family head.
In 1808 when his father died, he succeeded to his father to take over the position of the family head.

sen.j: 大番頭を務めた後の文化9年（1812年）2月から若年寄に任じられて幕政に参与した。
sen.e: After he served as Oban-gashira (a captain of the Great Guards of the shogunate government), he was appointed as a wakadoshiyori in February of 1812 and since then participated in the shogunate government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 「大番」が幕府組織であることを明確にするための説明的な句を追加しました。
sen.e: After he served as Oban-gashira (a captain of the Great Guards of the shogunate government), he was appointed as a wakadoshiyori in March, 1812 and since then participated in the shogunate government.
sen.cmt: in February of 1812 をin March, 1812 に修正しました。
sen.e: After he served as Oban-gashira (a captain of the Great Guards of the shogunate government), he was appointed as a wakadoshiyori in March, 1812 and since then participated in the shogunate government.

sen.j: 藩政では検地や寺社統治に尽力している。
sen.e: In the administration of his own domain, he made efforts in land surveys and regulation of shrines and temples.
In the administration of his own domain, he made efforts in land surveys and regulation of shrines and temples.
In the administration of his own domain, he made efforts in land surveys and regulation of shrines and temples.

sen.j: 天保3年（1832年）11月20日、家督を五男・高倍に譲って隠居したが、その高倍とさらにその後を継いだ息子の京極高鎮がわずかな間に自身に先立って次々と早世した。
sen.e: Although he transferred the headship of the family to his fifth son, Takamasu and went into retirement on November 20, 1832, Takamasu died soon after the succession and as one misfortune followed another, his seventh son, Takatsune, soon after succeeding to Takamasu, also predeceased his father Takamasa.

Although he transferred the headship of the family to his fifth son, Takamasu and went into retirement on December 11, 1832, Takamasu died soon after the succession and as one misfortune followed another, his seventh son, Takatsune, soon after succeeding to Takamasu, also predeceased his father Takamasa.
sen.cmt: November 20 を December 11 に修正しました。
sen.e: Although he transferred the headship of the family to his fifth son, Takamasu and went into retirement on December 11, 1832, Takamasu died soon after the succession and as one misfortune followed another, his seventh son, Takatsune, soon after succeeding to Takamasu, also predeceased his father Takamasa.

sen.j: 不幸な晩年の中で天保6年（1835年）5月3日に死去した。
sen.e: Thus, Takamasa was unhappy in his final years and died on May 3, 1835.
Takamasa had an unhappy life in his later years and died on May 29, 1835.
Takamasa had an unhappy life in his later years and died on May 29, 1835.
He died at the age of 79.
He died at the age of 79.
He died at the age of 79.

sen.j: 墓所：京都府京丹後市吉原の安泰山常立寺。
sen.e: His tomb is in Antaizan Joryu-ji Temple located in Yoshiwara, Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture.
His tomb is in Jyoryu-ji Temple on Mt. Antai located in Yoshiwara, Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Antaizan Joryu-ji Temple をJyoryu-ji Temple on Mt. Antai に修正しました。
sen.e: His tomb is in Jyoryu-ji Temple on Mt. Antai located in Yoshiwara, Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture.
